actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: Select Committee on the Strategic Competition between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 4(a) of House Resolution 5, 119th Congress, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Select Committee on the Strategic Competition between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party: Mr. Moolenaar, Chair, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Barr, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. LaHood, Mr. Dunn of Florida, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mrs. Hinson, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Bilirakis, Mrs. Kim of California, Mr. Moran, and Mr. Nunn of Iowa.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 4, 2025, at 1:28 p.m.: Appointment: Public Interest Declassification Board

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on January 30, 2025, at 3:24 p.m.: Appointments: United States Senate Caucus on International Narcotics Control.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 4.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nicholas J. Begich III to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
